questions.question: Their first child ............................... in
questions.description: The past tense is always used to express this idea.

questions.question: I ................................ my first car many years ago.
questions.description: The simple past is used to say when something happened.

questions.question: She ............................. in Madrid when she was a child.
questions.description: The simple past is used to say when something happened.

questions.question: When I ..................................... he ........................... in the garage.
questions.description: The simple past is used for the short action that happens in the middle of the longer background action.

questions.question: As I ................................ up the stairs, I ............................. a scream from one of the rooms.
questions.description: The simple past is used for the short action that happens in the middle of the longer background action.

questions.question: Smallpox .................................. millions of people before it ....................................
questions.description: Use the simple past to talk about a finished event in the past. The passive form is used to fill in the second blank because small pox is not the doer of the action.

questions.question: I .................................. for your drinks.
questions.description: Paid is the past form of pay. The present perfect is used to talk about finished events that are in some way related to the present.

questions.question: Between three and six I ...................................
questions.description: The past continuous is used to talk about an action or situation that was going on at a particular point of time in the past.

questions.question: I ............................... you .......................... lend me a few pounds.
questions.description: Past tenses are used to make requests sound more polite.
